content:
Can you use your coding skills to find the largest population of a city in Germany with a population of at least 100,000? You can use the following JavaScript code to retrieve data for German cities and their respective population. However, you will need to use logical reasoning and conditionals to identify the city with the highest population that meets the criteria. Good luck!
```
const germanyCities = [
  { name: "Berlin", population: 3769000 },
  { name: "Hamburg", population: 1845000 },
  { name: "Munich", population: 1472000 },
  { name: "Cologne", population: 1088000 },
  { name: "Frankfurt", population: 753056 },
  { name: "Stuttgart", population: 634830 },
  { name: "Düsseldorf", population: 619294 },
  { name: "Dortmund", population: 588994 },
  { name: "Essen", population: 583109 },
  { name: "Leipzig", population: 570087 },
  { name: "Bremen", population: 568321 },
  { name: "Dresden", population: 555805 },
  { name: "Hanover", population: 532163 },
  { name: "Nuremberg", population: 518370 },
  { name: "Duisburg", population: 498590 },
  { name: "Bochum", population: 364628 },
  { name: "Wuppertal", population: 354382 },
  { name: "Bielefeld", population: 333786 },
  { name: "Bonn", population: 327913 },
  { name: "Münster", population: 315293 },
];
//Your task is to write a code that will identify the German city with the highest population that meets the following criteria:
//1. Population should be at least 100,000.
//2. The city should have the highest population among all other cities that meet the first criteria.
